question: Can modulation of KCNQ1 splicing prevent arrhythmias?
ideal_answer: Amiloride reduces arrhythmogenicity through the modulation of KCNQ1 splicing. Therefore, the modulation of KCNQ1 splicing may help prevent arrhythmias.

snippets.text: Amiloride regulates IKs and APs with transmural differences and reduces arrhythmogenicity through the modulation of KCNQ1 splicing. We suggested that the modulation of KCNQ1 splicing may help prevent arrhythmia.
